symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.Chart
symbols.description:
Building block used to create a chart based on the metadata provided by OData V4. Overview of Building Blocks
Usually, a contextPath and metaPath is expected.
Usage example: 

<macros:Chart id="MyChart" contextPath="/RootEntity" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" />

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Metadata path to the entitySet or navigationProperty

properties.name: filterBar
properties.description: Id of the FilterBar building block associated with the chart.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies the header text that is shown in the chart

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Controls if the header text should be shown or not

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Metadata path to the presentation context (UI.Chart with or without a qualifier)

properties.name: personalization
properties.description:
Controls which options should be enabled for the chart personalization dialog.
If it is set to `true`, all possible options for this kind of chart are enabled.
If it is set to `false`, personalization is disabled.

You can also provide a more granular control for the personalization by providing a comma-separated list with the options you want to be available.
Available options are:
- Sort
- Type
- Item
- Filter

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description:
Defines the selection mode to be used by the chart.
Allowed values are `None`, `Single` or `Multiple`

properties.name: variantManagement
properties.description:
Controls the kind of variant management that should be enabled for the chart.
Allowed value is `Control`.
If set with value `Control`, a variant management control is seen within the chart and the chart is linked to this.
If not set with any value, variant management control is not available for this chart.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: An event triggered when chart selections are changed. The event contains information about the data selected/deselected and the Boolean flag that indicates whether data is selected or deselected.

methods.name: getContextPath
methods.description: Gets current value of property contextPath.

methods.name: getCurrentVariantKey

returnValue.description: Variant key of sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement applied to the chart

methods.description: Gets the key of the current variant in the associated variant management.

methods.name: getFilterBar
methods.description: Gets current value of property filterBar.

methods.name: getHeader
methods.description: Gets current value of property header.

methods.name: getHeaderVisible
methods.description: Gets current value of property headerVisible.

methods.name: getMetaPath
methods.description: Gets current value of property metaPath.

methods.name: getPersonalization
methods.description: Gets current value of property personalization.

methods.name: getPresentationVariant

returnValue.description: The presentation variant sap.fe.navigation.PresentationVariant applied to the chart

methods.description: Get the presentation variant that is currently applied on the chart.

methods.name: getSelectedContexts

returnValue.description: Contexts of the rows selected by the user

methods.description: Gets contexts from the chart that have been selected by the user.

methods.name: getSelectionMode
methods.description: Gets current value of property selectionMode.

methods.name: getSelectionVariant
methods.description: Get the selection variant from the chart. This function considers only the selection variant applied at the control level.

methods.name: getVariantManagement
methods.description: Gets current value of property variantManagement.

methods.name: setContextPath
methods.description: Gets current value of property contextPath.

methods.name: setCurrentVariantKey

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The variant key of sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement to be set

methods.description: Sets the variant of the provided key in the associated variant management.

methods.name: setFilterBar
methods.description: Gets current value of property filterBar.

methods.name: setHeader
methods.description: Gets current value of property header.

methods.name: setHeaderVisible
methods.description: Gets current value of property headerVisible.

methods.name: setMetaPath
methods.description: Gets current value of property metaPath.

methods.name: setPersonalization
methods.description: Gets current value of property personalization.

methods.name: setPresentationVariant

parameters.name: presentationVariant
parameters.description: the presentation variant sap.fe.navigation.PresentationVariant to be set

methods.description:
Set the presentation variant for the mdc chart.
The json format retrieved by using the get PresentationVariant button in the linked FPM sample should be followed while trying to set the PresentationVariant as needed. The values dimensions, measures and other properties should also be given in the valid format and null or empty values should be avoided. One dimension attribute should have only one role associated with it on a given chart.

methods.name: setSelectionMode
methods.description: Gets current value of property selectionMode.

methods.name: setSelectionVariant

parameters.name: selectionVariant
parameters.description: The sap.fe.navigation.SelectionVariant to apply to the chart

parameters.name: prefillDescriptions
parameters.description: Optional. If true, we will use the associated text property values (if they're available in the SelectionVariant) to display the filter value descriptions, instead of loading them from the backend

methods.description: Sets sap.fe.navigation.SelectionVariant to the chart. Note: setSelectionVariant will clear existing filters and then apply the SelectionVariant values.

methods.name: setVariantManagement
methods.description: Gets current value of property variantManagement.

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.CollaborativeDraftHandler
symbols.description: A BuildingBlock to watch the lock status of a property and to react on changes.

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block. This setting is defined by the framework, and can be overwritten.

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

properties.name: showAvatar
properties.description: If set to true, the standard Avatar control is displayed to indicate the lock status. If set to false, nothing is displayed.

events.name: lockChange
events.description:
Event fired when the lock status changes.
Parameters:
- isLocked : true if the property is locked, false otherwise
- lockingUserID: the ID of the user locking the property (undefined if not locked)
- lockingUserName: the name of the user locking the property (undefined if not locked)
- lockingUserInitials: the initials of the user locking the property (undefined if not locked)
- lockingUserColor: the color associated to the user locking the property (undefined if not locked)

symbols.title: class sap.fe.macros.CollaborativeDraftHandler

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.Field
symbols.description:
Building block for creating a field based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Usually, a DataField or DataPoint annotation is expected, but the field can also be used to display a property from the entity type. When creating a Field building block, you must provide an ID to ensure everything works correctly.
Usage example: 

<macros:Field id="MyField" metaPath="MyProperty" />
Overview of Building Blocks

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block. This setting is defined by the framework.

properties.name: description
properties.description: This is used to optionally provide an external description that comes from a different model than the oData model. This should be used in conjunction with the value property.

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description:
An expression that allows you to control the read-only state of the field.
If you do not set any expression, SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the current state.

properties.name: semanticObject
properties.description: Option to add semantic objects for a field. This parameter overwrites the semantic objects defined through annotations. Valid options are either a single semantic object, a stringified array of semantic objects, a formatter or a single binding expression returning either a single semantic object or an array of semantic objects.

properties.name: value
properties.description: This is used to optionally provide an external value that comes from a different model than the OData model. It is designed to work with a field with value help, and without support for complex value help (currency / unit).

aggregations.name: formatOptions
aggregations.description: A set of options that can be configured.

events.name: change
events.description: An event containing details is triggered when the value of the field is changed.

events.name: liveChange
events.description: An event containing details is triggered when the value of the field is live changed.

methods.name: addMessage

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to create message

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Message description

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message text

parameters.name: persistent
parameters.description: True if the message is persistent

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the message

methods.description: Adds a message to the field.

methods.name: getEnabled
methods.description: Gets the current enablement state of the field.

methods.name: getValue
methods.description: Retrieves the current value of the field.

methods.name: removeMessage

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the message

methods.description: Removes a message from the field.

methods.name: setEnabled
methods.description: Sets the current enablement state of the field.

methods.name: setValue
methods.description: Sets the current value of the field.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.macros.Field

symbols.description:
Building block used to create the ‘Share’ functionality.
Please note that the 'Share in SAP Jam' option is only available on platforms that are integrated with SAP Jam.
If you are consuming this macro in an environment where the SAP Fiori launchpad is not available, then the 'Save as Tile' option is not visible.
Usage example:

id="someID"
visible="true"
/>
Overview of Building Blocks

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.Status
symbols.description: Building block to display a status and criticality.

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Context path for the binding context.

properties.name: inverted
properties.description: Determines whether the background color reflects the set state of the ObjectStatus instead of the control's text.

properties.name: largeDesign
properties.description: Indicates whether the ObjectStatus should be displayed in large design mode.

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Metadata path to the DataField annotation or property.

properties.name: reactiveAreaMode
properties.description:
When the Status is clickable, it defines the size of the reactive area of the clickable element:
- ReactiveAreaMode.Inline - The Status is displayed as part of a sentence. - ReactiveAreaMode.Overlay - The Status is displayed as an overlay on top of other interactive parts of the page. Note: It is designed to make the clickable element easier to activate and helps meet the WCAG 2.2 Target Size requirement. It is applicable only for the SAP Horizon themes. Note: The size of the reactive area is sufficiently large to help users avoid accidentally selecting (clicking or tapping) unintended UI elements. UI elements positioned over other parts of the page may need an invisible active touch area. This ensures that no elements beneath are activated accidentally when the user tries to interact with the overlay element.

events.name: press
events.description: Press event fired when the ObjectStatus is clicked.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.macros.Status

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.chart.Chart
symbols.description:
Building block used to create a chart based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Usually, a contextPath and metaPath is expected.
Usage example: 

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/chart/Chart"], function(Chart) {
	 ...
	 new Chart("myChart", {metaPath:"MyChart"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the Chart that you get out of templates. The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Metadata path to the entitySet or navigationProperty

properties.name: filterBar
properties.description: Id of the FilterBar building block associated with the chart.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies the header text that is shown in the chart

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Controls if the header text should be shown or not

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Metadata path to the presentation context (UI.Chart with or without a qualifier)

properties.name: personalization
properties.description:
Controls which options should be enabled for the chart personalization dialog.
If it is set to `true`, all possible options for this kind of chart are enabled.
If it is set to `false`, personalization is disabled.

You can also provide a more granular control for the personalization by providing a comma-separated list with the options you want to be available.
Available options are:
- Sort
- Type
- Item
- Filter

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description:
Defines the selection mode to be used by the chart.
Allowed values are `None`, `Single` or `Multiple`

properties.name: variantManagement
properties.description:
Controls the kind of variant management that should be enabled for the chart.
Allowed value is `Control`.
If set with value `Control`, a variant management control is seen within the chart and the chart is linked to this.

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.field.Field
symbols.description:
Building block for creating a field based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Usually, a DataField or DataPoint annotation is expected, but the field can also be used to display a property from the entity type. When creating a Field building block, you must provide an ID to ensure everything works correctly.
Usage example: 

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/field/Field"], function(Field) {
	 ...
	 new Field("MyField", {metaPath:"MyProperty"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the Field that you get out of templates. The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block. This setting is defined by the framework.

properties.name: description
properties.description: This is used to optionally provide an external description that comes from a different model than the oData model. This should be used in conjunction with the value property.

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description:
An expression that allows you to control the read-only state of the field.
If you do not set any expression, SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the current state.

properties.name: semanticObject
properties.description: Option to add semantic objects for a field. This parameter overwrites the semantic objects defined through annotations. Valid options are either a single semantic object, a stringified array of semantic objects, a formatter or a single binding expression returning either a single semantic object or an array of semantic objects.

properties.name: value
properties.description: This is used to optionally provide an external value that comes from a different model than the OData model. It is designed to work with a field with value help, and without support for complex value help (currency / unit).

aggregations.name: formatOptions
aggregations.description: A set of options that can be configured.

events.name: change
events.description: An event containing details is triggered when the value of the field is changed.

events.name: liveChange
events.description: An event containing details is triggered when the value of the field is live changed.

methods.name: addMessage

parameters.description: The parameters to create message

parameters.description: Message description

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message text

parameters.name: persistent
parameters.description: True if the message is persistent

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the message

methods.description: Adds a message to the field.

methods.name: getEnabled
methods.description: Gets the current enablement state of the field.

methods.name: getValue
methods.description: Retrieves the current value of the field.

methods.name: removeMessage

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the message

methods.description: Removes a message from the field.

methods.name: setEnabled
methods.description: Sets the current enablement state of the field.

methods.name: setValue
methods.description: Sets the current value of the field.

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.field.FieldFormatOptions
symbols.description: Additional format options for the field.

properties.name: dateTimePattern
properties.description:
Property for defining a custom pattern for the date, time, or dateTime format.
If a dateTimePattern is defined, the dateTimeStyle is ignored.

properties.name: dateTimeStyle
properties.description:
Property for defining the display style for the date, time, or dateTime format.
If there is a dateTimePattern defined, dateTimeStyle is ignored.

properties.name: displayMode
properties.description:
Defines how the field value and associated text will be displayed together.

Allowed values are "Value", "Description", "DescriptionValue" and "ValueDescription"

properties.name: fieldEditStyle
properties.description:
Determines how the field should be rendered, e.g. as radio buttons.
If not all prerequisites are met, the field will default back to the standard rendering.

properties.name: measureDisplayMode
properties.description:
Defines if and how the field measure will be displayed.

Allowed values are "Hidden" and "ReadOnly"

properties.name: radioButtonsHorizontalLayout
properties.description: Specifies if radio buttons should be rendered in a horizontal layout.

properties.name: reactiveAreaMode
properties.description:
When the Field is displayed as a clickable element, it defines the size of the reactive area of the clickable element:
- ReactiveAreaMode.Inline - The link is displayed as part of a sentence. - ReactiveAreaMode.Overlay - The link is displayed as an overlay on top of other interactive parts of the page. Note: It is designed to make the clickable element easier to activate and helps meet the WCAG 2.2 Target Size requirement. It is applicable only for the SAP Horizon themes. Note: The size of the reactive area is sufficiently large to help users avoid accidentally selecting (clicking or tapping) unintended UI elements. UI elements positioned over other parts of the page may need an invisible active touch area. This ensures that no elements beneath are activated accidentally when the user tries to interact with the overlay element.

properties.name: showDate
properties.description:
Defines if the date part of a date time with timezone field should be shown.

The dateTimeOffset field must have a timezone annotation.
The default value is true.

properties.name: showTime
properties.description:
Defines if the time part of a date time with timezone field should be shown.

The dateTimeOffset field must have a timezone annotation.
The default value is true.

properties.name: showTimezone
properties.description:
Defines if the timezone part of a date time with timezone field should be shown.

The dateTimeOffset field must have a timezone annotation.
The default value is true.

properties.name: textExpandBehaviorDisplay
properties.description:
Defines how the full text will be displayed.

Allowed values are "InPlace" and "Popover"

properties.name: textLinesEdit
properties.description: Maximum number of lines for multiline texts in edit mode.

properties.name: textMaxCharactersDisplay
properties.description: Maximum number of characters from the beginning of the text field that are shown initially.

properties.name: textMaxLength
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of characters for the multiline text value.

If a multiline text exceeds the maximum number of allowed characters, the counter below the input field displays the exact number.

properties.name: textMaxLines
properties.description: Maximum number of lines that multiline texts in edit mode can grow to.

symbols.description:
Usage example: 

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/filterBar/FilterBar"], function(FilterBar) {

	 new FilterBar("MyFilterBar", {metaPath:"@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionFields"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the FilterBar that you get out of templates. The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block. This setting is defined by the framework.

properties.name: liveMode
properties.description: If true, the search is triggered automatically when a filter value is changed.

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

properties.description: Handles the visibility of the 'Clear' button on the FilterBar.

properties.name: showMessages
properties.description: Displays possible errors during the search in a message box

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Parameter which sets the visibility of the FilterBar building block

aggregations.name: filterFields
aggregations.description: Aggregate filter fields of the FilterBar building block

events.name: afterClear
events.description: This event is fired when the 'Clear' button is pressed. This is only possible when the 'Clear' button is enabled.

events.name: filterChanged
events.description: This event is fired after either a filter value or the visibility of a filter item has been changed. The event contains conditions that will be used as filters.

events.name: search
events.description: This event is fired when the 'Go' button is pressed or after a condition change.

methods.name: getActiveFiltersText
methods.description: Get the Active Filters Text Summary for the filter bar.

methods.name: getCurrentVariantKey

returnValue.description: Key of the currently selected variant. In case the model is not yet set, `null` will be returned.

parameters.description: Name of the field.

parameters.name: conditionPath
parameters.description: The path to the property as a condition path

methods.name: getFilters

returnValue.description: An array of active filters and the search expression.

methods.description: Provides all the filters that are currently active along with the search expression.

methods.name: getSelectionVariant

returnValue.description: A promise which resolves with a sap.fe.navigation.SelectionVariant

methods.description: Get the selection variant from the filter bar. Note: This method returns all the filter values that are set in the filter bar, including the text from the search field (with $search as the property name). However, it doesn't return any filter field condition that uses a custom operator.

methods.name: setCurrentVariantKey

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the variant that should be selected. If the passed key doesn't identify a variant, it will be ignored.

methods.description: Sets the new selected variant in the associated variant management.

methods.name: setFilterFieldEnabled

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the field that should be enabled or disabled.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether the field should be enabled or disabled.

methods.description: Sets the enablement of the field.

returnValue.description: A Promise resolving once the change in visibility was applied

parameters.name: conditionPath
parameters.description: The path to the property as a condition path

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: Whether it should be shown or hidden

methods.description: Shows or hides any filter field from the filter bar. The property will not be hidden inside the adaptation dialog and may be re-added.

methods.name: setFilterValues

parameters.name: sConditionPath
parameters.description: The path to the property as a condition path

parameters.name: sOperator
parameters.description: The operator to be used (optional) - if not set, the default operator (EQ) will be used

parameters.name: vValues
parameters.description: The values to be applied

methods.description: Set the filter values for the given property in the filter bar. The filter values can be either a single value or an array of values. Each filter value must be represented as a primitive value.

methods.name: setSelectionVariant

parameters.name: selectionVariant
parameters.description: The sap.fe.navigation.SelectionVariant to apply to the filter bar

parameters.name: prefillDescriptions
parameters.description: Optional. If true, we will use the associated text property values (if they're available in the selectionVariant) to display the filter value descriptions, instead of loading them from the backend

methods.description: Sets sap.fe.navigation.SelectionVariant to the filter bar. Note: setSelectionVariant will clear existing filters and then apply the SelectionVariant values. Note: This method cannot set the search field text or any filter field condition that relies on a custom operator.

methods.name: triggerSearch

returnValue.description: Returns a promise which resolves if filter go is triggered successfully; otherwise gets rejected.

methods.description: Triggers the API search on the filter bar.

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.Table
symbols.description:
Building block used to create a table based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Usually, a LineItem, PresentationVariant, or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation is expected, but the Table building block can also be used to display an EntitySet.
If a PresentationVariant is specified, then it must have UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.
If a SelectionPresentationVariant is specified, then it must contain a valid PresentationVariant that also has a UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.
Usage example: 

<macros:Table id="MyTable" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem" />
Overview of Table Building Blocks

properties.name: busy
properties.description: An expression that allows you to control the 'busy' state of the table.

properties.name: condensedTableLayout
properties.description: Determines whether the table adapts to the condensed layout.

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block. This setting is defined by the framework.

properties.name: creationMode
properties.description: A set of options that can be configured.

properties.name: disableColumnFreeze
properties.description:
Determines whether the number of fixed columns can be configured in the Column Settings dialog.
This property doesn't apply for responsive tables

properties.name: disableCopyToClipboard
properties.description: Controls if the copy functionality of the table is disabled or not.

properties.name: enableAutoColumnWidth
properties.description: Specifies if the column width is automatically calculated.

properties.name: enableExport
properties.description: Controls if the export functionality of the table is enabled or not.

properties.name: enableFullScreen
properties.description: Controls whether the table can be opened in fullscreen mode or not.

properties.name: enablePaste
properties.description: Controls if the paste functionality of the table is enabled or not.

properties.name: enablePastingOfComputedProperties
properties.description: Determine whether the data copied to the computed columns is sent to the back end.

properties.name: enableSelectAll
properties.description: Determines whether the Clear All button is enabled by default. To enable the Clear All button by default, you must set this property to false.

properties.name: exportFileName
properties.description: Configures the file name of exported table. It's limited to 31 characters. If the name is longer, it will be truncated.

properties.name: exportRequestSize
properties.description: Maximum allowed number of records to be exported in one request.

properties.name: exportSheetName
properties.description: Configures the sheet name of exported table. It's limited to 31 characters. If the name is longer, it will be truncated.

properties.name: filterBar
properties.description: ID of the FilterBar building block associated with the table.

properties.name: frozenColumnCount
properties.description:
Number of columns that are fixed on the left. Only columns which are not fixed can be scrolled horizontally.
This property is not relevant for responsive tables

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies the header text that is shown in the table.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Controls if the header text should be shown or not.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the Table building block.
The table building block is not going to create built-in columns or offer table personalization for comma-separated value of fields that are provided in the ignoredfields.
Any column referencing an ignored field is to be removed.

properties.name: isSearchable
properties.description: Defines whether to display the search action.

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Defines the relative path to a LineItem, PresentationVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

properties.name: modeForNoDataMessage
properties.description: Changes the size of the IllustratedMessage in the table, or removes it completely. Allowed values are `illustratedMessage-Auto`, `illustratedMessage-Base`, `illustratedMessage-Dialog`, `illustratedMessage-Dot`, `illustratedMessage-Scene`, `illustratedMessage-Spot` or `text`.

properties.name: personalization
properties.description:
Controls which options should be enabled for the table personalization dialog.
If it is set to `true`, all possible options for this kind of table are enabled.
If it is set to `false`, personalization is disabled.

You can also provide a more granular control for the personalization by providing a comma-separated list with the options you want to be available.
Available options are:
- Sort
- Column
- Filter
- Group

The Group option is only applicable to analytical tables and responsive tables.

properties.name: popinLayout
properties.description:
Defines the layout options of the table popins. Only applies to responsive tables.
Allowed values are `Block`, `GridLarge`, and `GridSmall`.
- `Block`: Sets a block layout for rendering the table popins. The elements inside the popin container are rendered one below the other.
- `GridLarge`: Sets a grid layout for rendering the table popins. The grid width for each table popin is comparatively larger than GridSmall, so this layout allows less content to be rendered in a single popin row.
- `GridSmall`: Sets a grid layout for rendering the table popins. The grid width for each table popin is small, so this layout allows more content to be rendered in a single popin row.

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description:
An expression that allows you to control the 'read-only' state of the table.
If you do not set any expression, SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the current state.

properties.name: rowCount
properties.description: Number of rows to be displayed in the table. Does not apply to responsive tables.

properties.name: rowCountMode
properties.description:
Defines how the table handles the visible rows. Does not apply to Responsive tables.
Allowed values are `Auto`, `Fixed`, and `Interactive`.
- If set to `Fixed`, the table always has as many rows as defined in the rowCount property.
- If set to `Auto`, the number of rows is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) but it cannot have less than defined in the `rowCount` property.
- If set to `Interactive` the table can have as many rows as defined in the rowCount property. This number of rows can be modified by dragging the resizer available in this mode.

properties.name: scrollThreshold
properties.description: Defines how many additional data records are requested from the back-end system when the user scrolls vertically in the table.

properties.name: selectionLimit
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of rows that can be selected at once in the table. This property does not apply to responsive tables.

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description:
Defines the selection mode to be used by the table.
Allowed values are `None`, `Single`, `ForceSingle`, `Multi`, `ForceMulti` or `Auto`. If set to 'Single', 'Multi' or 'Auto', SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the consistent selection mode. If set to 'ForceSingle' or 'ForceMulti' your choice will be respected but this might not respect the Fiori guidelines.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Defines the number of records to be initially requested from the back end.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Defines the type of table that will be used by the building block to render the data.
Allowed values are `GridTable`, `ResponsiveTable` and `AnalyticalTable`.

properties.name: variantManagement
properties.description:
Controls the kind of variant management that should be enabled for the table.
Allowed value is `Control`.
If set with value `Control`, a variant management control is seen within the table and the table is linked to this.
If not set with any value, control level variant management is not available for this table.

properties.name: widthIncludingColumnHeader
properties.description: Indicates if the column header should be a part of the width calculation.

aggregations.name: analyticalConfiguration
aggregations.description: A set of options that can be configured to control the aggregation behavior

aggregations.name: noData
aggregations.description: Aggregation to forward the IllustratedMessage control to the mdc control.

events.name: beforeRebindTable
events.description:
Before a table rebind, an event is triggered that contains information about the binding.
The event contains a parameter, `collectionBindingInfo`, which is an instance of `CollectionBindingInfoAPI`. It can also contain an optional parameter, `quickFilterKey`, which indicates what is the quick filter key (if any) being processed for the table. This allows you to manipulate the table's list binding. You can use this event to attach event handlers to the table's list binding. You can use this event to add selects, and add or read the sorters and filters.

events.name: rowPress
events.description:
An event is triggered when the user chooses a row; the event contains information about which row is chosen.
You can set this in order to handle the navigation manually.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: An event triggered when the selection in the table changes.

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.table.Table
symbols.description:
Building block used to create a table based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Usually, a LineItem, PresentationVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation is expected, but the Table building block can also be used to display an EntitySet.
If a PresentationVariant is specified, then it must have UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.
If a SelectionPresentationVariant is specified, then it must contain a valid PresentationVariant that also has a UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/table/Table"], function(Table) {

	 new Table("myTable", {metaPath:"@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the Table that you get out of templates. The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.macros.table.Table

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.table.TableCreationOptions
symbols.description: Create options for the table.

properties.name: createAtEnd
properties.description:
Specifies if the new entry should be created at the top or bottom of a table in case of creationMode 'Inline'
The default value is 'false'

properties.name: creationFields
properties.description:
Defines the list of properties that will be displayed in the creation dialog, when the creation mode is set to 'CreationDialog'.
The value is a comma-separated list of property names.

properties.name: inlineCreationRowsHiddenInEditMode
properties.description:
Specifies if the new entry should be hidden in case of creationMode 'InlineCreationRows'. This only applies to responsive tables.
The default value is 'false'

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Defines the creation mode to be used by the table.
Allowed values are `NewPage`, `Inline`, `InlineCreationsRows`, `External` or `CreationDialog`.

NewPage - the created document is shown in a new page, depending on whether metadata 'Sync', 'Async' or 'Deferred' is used
Inline - The creation is done inline
InlineCreationsRows - The creation is done inline with an empty row
External - The creation is done in a different application specified via the parameter 'outbound' CreationDialog - the creation is done in the table, with a dialog allowing to specify some initial property values (the properties are listed in `creationFields`).

If not set with any value:
if navigation is defined, the default value is 'NewPage'. Otherwise it is 'Inline'.

properties.name: outbound
properties.description: The navigation target where the document is created in case of creationMode 'External'

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.TreeTable
symbols.description: Building block used to create a tree table based on the metadata provided by OData V4. Overview of Tree Table Building Block

properties.name: busy
properties.description: An expression that allows you to control the 'busy' state of the table.

properties.name: condensedTableLayout
properties.description: Determines whether the table adapts to the condensed layout.

properties.name: contextPath
properties.description: Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block. This setting is defined by the framework.

properties.name: creationMode
properties.description: A set of options that can be configured.

properties.name: disableColumnFreeze
properties.description:
Determines whether the number of fixed columns can be configured in the Column Settings dialog.
This property doesn't apply for responsive tables

properties.name: disableCopyToClipboard
properties.description: Controls if the copy functionality of the table is disabled or not.

properties.name: enableAutoColumnWidth
properties.description: Specifies if the column width is automatically calculated.

properties.name: enableExport
properties.description: Controls if the export functionality of the table is enabled or not.

properties.name: enableFullScreen
properties.description: Controls whether the table can be opened in fullscreen mode or not.

properties.name: enablePaste
properties.description: Controls if the paste functionality of the table is enabled or not.

properties.name: enablePastingOfComputedProperties
properties.description: Determine whether the data copied to the computed columns is sent to the back end.

properties.name: enableSelectAll
properties.description: Determines whether the Clear All button is enabled by default. To enable the Clear All button by default, you must set this property to false.

properties.name: exportFileName
properties.description: Configures the file name of exported table. It's limited to 31 characters. If the name is longer, it will be truncated.

properties.name: exportRequestSize
properties.description: Maximum allowed number of records to be exported in one request.

properties.name: exportSheetName
properties.description: Configures the sheet name of exported table. It's limited to 31 characters. If the name is longer, it will be truncated.

properties.name: filterBar
properties.description: ID of the FilterBar building block associated with the table.

properties.name: frozenColumnCount
properties.description:
Number of columns that are fixed on the left. Only columns which are not fixed can be scrolled horizontally.
This property is not relevant for responsive tables

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies the header text that is shown in the table.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Controls if the header text should be shown or not.

properties.name: hierarchyQualifier
properties.description: A set of options that can be configured.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the Table building block.
The table building block is not going to create built-in columns or offer table personalization for comma-separated value of fields that are provided in the ignoredfields.
Any column referencing an ignored field is to be removed.

properties.name: isCopyToPositionAllowed
properties.description: Defines the extension point to control whether a source node can be copied to a specific parent node.

properties.name: isMoveToPositionAllowed
properties.description: Defines the extension point to control whether a source node can be dropped on a specific parent node.

properties.name: isNodeCopyable
properties.description: efines the extension point to control whether a node can be copied.

properties.name: isNodeMovable
properties.description: Defines the extension point to control if a node can be dragged.

properties.name: isSearchable
properties.description: Defines whether to display the search action.

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Defines the relative path to a LineItem, PresentationVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

properties.name: modeForNoDataMessage
properties.description: Changes the size of the IllustratedMessage in the table, or removes it completely. Allowed values are `illustratedMessage-Auto`, `illustratedMessage-Base`, `illustratedMessage-Dialog`, `illustratedMessage-Dot`, `illustratedMessage-Scene`, `illustratedMessage-Spot` or `text`.

properties.name: personalization
properties.description:
Controls which options should be enabled for the table personalization dialog.
If it is set to `true`, all possible options for this kind of table are enabled.
If it is set to `false`, personalization is disabled.

You can also provide a more granular control for the personalization by providing a comma-separated list with the options you want to be available.
Available options are:
- Sort
- Column
- Filter
- Group

The Group option is only applicable to analytical tables and responsive tables.

properties.name: popinLayout
properties.description:
Defines the layout options of the table popins. Only applies to responsive tables.
Allowed values are `Block`, `GridLarge`, and `GridSmall`.
- `Block`: Sets a block layout for rendering the table popins. The elements inside the popin container are rendered one below the other.
- `GridLarge`: Sets a grid layout for rendering the table popins. The grid width for each table popin is comparatively larger than GridSmall, so this layout allows less content to be rendered in a single popin row.
- `GridSmall`: Sets a grid layout for rendering the table popins. The grid width for each table popin is small, so this layout allows more content to be rendered in a single popin row.

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description:
An expression that allows you to control the 'read-only' state of the table.
If you do not set any expression, SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the current state.

properties.name: rowCount
properties.description: Number of rows to be displayed in the table. Does not apply to responsive tables.

properties.name: rowCountMode
properties.description:
Defines how the table handles the visible rows. Does not apply to Responsive tables.
Allowed values are `Auto`, `Fixed`, and `Interactive`.
- If set to `Fixed`, the table always has as many rows as defined in the rowCount property.
- If set to `Auto`, the number of rows is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) but it cannot have less than defined in the `rowCount` property.
- If set to `Interactive` the table can have as many rows as defined in the rowCount property. This number of rows can be modified by dragging the resizer available in this mode.

properties.name: scrollThreshold
properties.description: Defines how many additional data records are requested from the back-end system when the user scrolls vertically in the table.

properties.name: selectionLimit
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of rows that can be selected at once in the table. This property does not apply to responsive tables.

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description:
Defines the selection mode to be used by the table.
Allowed values are `None`, `Single`, `ForceSingle`, `Multi`, `ForceMulti` or `Auto`. If set to 'Single', 'Multi' or 'Auto', SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the consistent selection mode. If set to 'ForceSingle' or 'ForceMulti' your choice will be respected but this might not respect the Fiori guidelines.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Defines the number of records to be initially requested from the back end.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Defines the type of table that will be used by the building block to render the data. This setting is defined by the framework.
Allowed value is `TreeTable`.

properties.name: variantManagement
properties.description:
Controls the kind of variant management that should be enabled for the table.
Allowed value is `Control`.
If set with value `Control`, a variant management control is seen within the table and the table is linked to this.
If not set with any value, control level variant management is not available for this table.

properties.name: widthIncludingColumnHeader
properties.description: Indicates if the column header should be a part of the width calculation.

aggregations.name: analyticalConfiguration
aggregations.description: A set of options that can be configured to control the aggregation behavior

aggregations.name: noData
aggregations.description: Aggregation to forward the IllustratedMessage control to the mdc control.

events.name: beforeRebindTable
events.description:
Before a table rebind, an event is triggered that contains information about the binding.
The event contains a parameter, `collectionBindingInfo`, which is an instance of `CollectionBindingInfoAPI`. It can also contain an optional parameter, `quickFilterKey`, which indicates what is the quick filter key (if any) being processed for the table. This allows you to manipulate the table's list binding. You can use this event to attach event handlers to the table's list binding. You can use this event to add selects, and add or read the sorters and filters.

events.name: rowPress
events.description:
An event is triggered when the user chooses a row; the event contains information about which row is chosen.
You can set this in order to handle the navigation manually.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: An event triggered when the selection in the table changes.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.macros.TreeTable

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.table.TreeTable
symbols.description:
Building block used to create a table based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Usually, a LineItem, PresentationVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation is expected, but the Table building block can also be used to display an EntitySet.
If a PresentationVariant is specified, then it must have UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.
If a SelectionPresentationVariant is specified, then it must contain a valid PresentationVariant that also has a UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.
Usage example: 

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/table/TreeTable"], function(TreeTable) {
	 ...
	 new TreeTable("myTable", {metaPath:"@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the Table that you get out of templates. The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.table.TreeTableCreationOptions
symbols.description: Create options for the tree table.

properties.name: createInPlace
properties.description:
Specifies if the new entry should be placed at the position computed by the backend (e.g. taking sorting into account).
The default value is 'false' (that is, the new entry is placed as the first child below its parent).

properties.name: creationFields
properties.description:
Defines the list of properties that will be displayed in the creation dialog, when the creation mode is set to 'CreationDialog'.
The value is a comma-separated list of property names.

properties.name: isCreateEnabled
properties.description: Defines the extension point to control the enablement of the Create button or Create Menu buttons.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Defines the creation mode to be used by the tree table.
Allowed values are `NewPage`, `Inline` or `CreationDialog`.

NewPage - the created document is shown in a new page, depending on whether metadata 'Sync', 'Async' or 'Deferred' is used.
Inline - the creation is done inline.
CreationDialog - the creation is done in the table, with a dialog allowing to specify some initial property values (the properties are listed in `creationFields`).

If not set with any value:
if navigation is defined, the default value is 'NewPage'. Otherwise it is 'Inline'.

properties.name: nodeType
properties.description:
Defines the nodes to be added on the custom create.
This object must have the following properties: propertyName: the name of the property on the page entity set used to categorize the node type to be created within the hierarchy
values: an array of key, label and an optional creationFields that define a value of the property defined by the propertyName key, its label, and the specific fields to be shown in the creation dialog.

allowedValues: values?: { key: string; label: string; creationFields?: string }[];

symbols.name: sap.fe.macros.controls.section.ISingleSectionContributor
symbols.description:
This interface should be implemented by controls to define it's behaviour when it is the only control in a Fiori Elements Object Page Section.

The Fiori Elements Object Page Section checks if it has only one control at runtime and then calls the relevant methods if the control implements the interface.

Incase of a composite control or controls placed inside layouts (VBox, HBox, FlexBox) etc. it should always be the root/layout control that implements this interface. It is upto the root/layout contrl in this case of interact with inner controls.

Control must implement getSectionContentRole to define whether it is a "provider" or a "consumer".

- provider: Building block is the provider of information to the section
- consumer: Building block is the consumer of information provided by the section

If the control is a "provider" then it should implement the getDataFromProvider method and return ProviderData.
If the control is a "consumer" then it should implement the sendDataToConsumer method and consume ConsumerData.

methods.name: getDataFromProvider

returnValue.description: The data from the provider which is needed by the section.

methods.description: When the content role is "provider" this method is called by the section to get the information from the the provider.

methods.name: getSectionContentRole

returnValue.description: The role played by the control when it is the only content in the Fiori Elements Object Page Section.

methods.description:
Defines the role of a control when it is the only content in the section. Allowed roles are "provider" and "consumer".

provider: control is the provider of information to the section. Control provides the information and section acts on it.

consumer: control is the consumer of information provided by the section. Section provides the information and the control acts on it.

methods.name: sendDataToConsumer

parameters.name: consumerData
parameters.description: Data provide by the section to the control.

methods.description: When the content role is "consumer" this method is called by the section to collect and send information from the section to the control.

nodes.name: sap.fe.macros.filterBar.FilterBar
nodes.description:
Usage example: 

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/filterBar/FilterBar"], function(FilterBar) {
	 ...
	 new FilterBar("MyFilterBar", {metaPath:"@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionFields"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the FilterBar that you get out of templates. The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

nodes.name: sap.fe.macros.filterBar.FilterField
nodes.description:
Definition of a custom filter to be used inside the FilterBar.
The template for the FilterField has to be provided as the default aggregation
Overview of Building Blocks

nodes.name: sap.fe.macros.microchart.MicroChart
nodes.description:
Building block used to create a MicroChart based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

Usually, a contextPath and metaPath is expected.
Usage example: 

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/microchart/MicroChart"], function(MicroChart) {
	 ...
	 new MicroChart("microChartID", {metaPath:"MyProperty"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the MicroChart that you get out of templates. The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.
